data.Sentence_cn: 我是个学艺术的学生，画了很多画。
data.Sentence: I am an art student and I paint a lot of pictures.

data.Sentence_cn: 有很多人装成很懂现代艺术的样子，
data.Sentence: Many people pretend that they understand modern art.

data.Sentence_cn: 总是告诉你一幅画的“意思”是什么。
data.Sentence: They always tell you what a picture is "about".

data.Sentence_cn: 当然，有很多画是什么“意思”也没有的。
data.Sentence: Of course, many pictures are not "about" anything.

data.Sentence_cn: 它们就是些好看的图案，
我们喜爱它们就像我们喜欢漂亮的窗帘布一样。
data.Sentence: We like them in the same way that we like pretty curtain material.

data.Sentence_cn: 我觉得小孩子们往往比任何人都更能欣赏现代绘画，他们观察到的东西更多。
data.Sentence: I think that young children often appreciate modern pictures better than anyone else. They notice more.

data.Sentence_cn: 我的妹妹只有7岁，但她总能说出我的画是好还是坏。
data.Sentence: My sister is only seven, but she always tells me whether my pictures are good or not.

data.Sentence_cn: 昨天她到我房里来了。“你在干什么？”，她问道。
data.Sentence: She came into my room yesterday.  "What are you doing?" she asked.

data.Sentence_cn: “我正把这幅画挂到墙上去。”我回答说，“这是幅新画,你喜欢吗？”
data.Sentence: "I'm hanging this picture on the wall," I answered. "It's a new one. Do you like it?"

data.Sentence_cn: 她用挑剔的目光看了一会儿。
data.Sentence: She looked at it critically for a moment.

data.Sentence_cn: “还可以吧。”她说，“不过，是不是挂倒了？”
data.Sentence: "It's all right," she said, "but isn't it upside down?"
